questions.q: Your company wants to purchase some network hardware to connect its separate networks together. What kind of network device is appropriate?
questions.explanation: Routers are the primary devices used to provide connectivity between different LANs and direct data packets across network boundaries.
A host node (or endpoint) is any addressable device on a network, such as a client or a server.

questions.q: A network within a city of area around 30 kilometers, is more likely to be...
questions.explanation: Metropolitan Area Networks connect LANs within a common geographic area like a city, typically spanning 5 to 50 kilometers.

questions.q: A software application that filters traffic entering and exiting a PC is
questions.explanation: Unlike hardware network firewalls, host-based firewalls are software applications installed on a host to filter its specific incoming and outgoing traffic.

questions.q: The topology in which nodes are only connected to the nodes they interact with most is known as...
questions.explanation: In this specific mesh variant, nodes are only connected to the devices they interact with most, rather than every node.

questions.q: The topology that consists of a central hub or switch, through which all of the data passes, along with all of the peripheral nodes connected to that central node is...
questions.explanation: In a star topology, all data passes through a central wiring point (the hub or switch) to which all peripheral nodes are connected.

questions.q: A campus network that is reside in an area around 800 meters, is more likely to be...
questions.explanation: Local Area Networks are used for limited areas like a campus or building and typically span up to 1 km in radius.

questions.q: A data has been encapsulated with three separate headers and one trailer. What is the appropriate name for this PDU?
questions.explanation: During the encapsulation process, the Data Link layer adds a header and a trailer to the packet (which already contains L4 and L3 headers), resulting in three total headers.

questions.q: The Link Layer of the TCP/IP Model is equivalent to which layer in the OSI Model
questions.explanation: The Link layer in the TCP/IP suite corresponds to both the Physical and Data Link layers of the OSI reference model.

questions.q: The Layer that provides a node-to-node connectivity in the OSI Model is...
questions.explanation: The Data Link layer is specifically responsible for providing node-to-node connectivity and data transfer, such as between a PC and a switch.

questions.q: Full mesh topology is considered a very expensive topology.
questions.explanation: Mesh topologies are noted as being expensive and difficult to install because every node is connected to every other node.

questions.q: In Limited Broadcast the data reaches from a source to all the host in a same network.
questions.explanation: The lecture states that in a limited broadcast, data travels from the source to every host within the same network.

questions.q: Video Conferencing is an example of half-duplex communication.
questions.explanation: Video conferencing is an example of Full-Duplex communication because it allows multiple parties to see, hear, and interact with each other simultaneously.

questions.q: Data in Transport Layer is called Segment.
questions.explanation: Protocol Data Units (PDUs) in the Transport Layer (Layer 4) are specifically referred to as segments.

questions.q: Session establishment is handled by layer 5 in the OSI model.
questions.explanation: The Session Layer (Layer 5) is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating connections (sessions) between communicating hosts.

questions.answer: A connection point in a communication network or any addressable device connected to a network. These nodes have the capability to send, receive, store, process, or create information, and can forward transmissions to other nodes.

A software application that filters traffic entering and exiting a specific host machine, such as a PC. Unlike hardware network firewalls that filter traffic between entire networks, these are installed directly on the device to protect it.
